oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Quarterly report on the condition and quality of the ordnance stores in the possession of Company K, 5th Regiment Tennessee Volunteers Cavalry
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. Users are solely responsible for determining the existence of such instances and for obtaining any other permissions and paying associated fees that may be necessary for the intended use.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Military weapons -- United States; Robinson, Wingate Truitt, 1832-1903; United States -- Army -- Tennessee Cavalry Regiment, 5th (1862-1865); United States -- Army -- Ordnance Corps
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This questionnaire from the Ordnance Department requires every officer commanding a company or regiment of cavalry to answer the questions and return the form to the Ordance Office along with their regular quarterly return of ordnance stores.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: United States -- Army -- Ordnance Corps
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In order to try to keep each unit supplied with its basic needs, the Ordnance Deptartment requested up-to-date information on horse equipment (bridles, halters, and saddles); pistols, rifles, and carbines; ammunition; sabres; and other accoutrements.
